meanings.definition: A young onion with a small bulb and long green leaves.
meanings.sent1: I chopped up a scallion to add flavor to the soup.
meanings.sent2: The scallion added a fresh crunch to the salad.
meanings.sent3: The scallion and the onion had a race to see who could reach the kitchen first.
meanings.sent4: The scallion stood tall among the other vegetables in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant green of the scallion made it stand out on the cutting board.

meanings.definition: A plant related to the onion, with a small bulb and long green leaves used in cooking.
meanings.sent1: The scallion plant in the garden is thriving.
meanings.sent2: I love the aroma of fresh scallions sautéing in the pan.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to steal the scallion from the garden but got caught.
meanings.sent4: The scallion danced in the stir-fry, adding a burst of flavor.
meanings.sent5: The scallion's delicate leaves added a pop of color to the dish.
